result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas W Troendle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • Strangulation and Suffocation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • Intimidate Victim/Dissuade Reporting, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.44(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Per Angel at Department of Corrections
from 11 Maple Lane, Fennimore, WI address - moved, left no forwarding address.
Restitution Breakdown

ADDRESS INFO for Nicholas W Troendle
Current: 11 Maple Lane, Fennimore, WI 53809 United States  (Effective: 05-30-2019)
Prior: 210 Grove St Apt #203, Ridgeway, WI 53582

09:28 AM Defendant Nicholas W Troendle in court with attorney Tara L. Teesch.  Defendant Nicholas W Troendle in custody.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file, reviews PSI from DOC.  Victim WP makes statement to the court.  State gives sentencing recommendation, makes statement.  Defense joins in the State's recommendation, makes statement. Defendant apologizes to the victims, makes statement.  Court makes statement, imposes sentence.  Bond is no longer in effect.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on May 30, 2019 at 09:30 am.
from DOC Agent Katrina Meyer requesting 30 days extension to complete PSI.  Court reschedules hearing to 5/30/19.

08:30 AM Defendant Nicholas W Troendle in court with attorney Tara L. Teesch.  Defendant Nicholas W Troendle in custody.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file, questions where matter is at.  Atty Teesch requests another date for sentencing as she needs some more time to get up to speed on the case.  State has no objection.  Court question whether counsel would like PSI updated from almost 3 years ago. State interested in having the PSI updated. Defense concered that update may take up to 2 months. Court orders DOC to update PSI with hopes that DOC can have report done within 30 days. Bond remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 29, 2019 at 02:15 pm.
Clerk LS contact SPD to see if counsel will be appointed for defendant.  SPD hasn't heard from Atty Lancaster, will contact defendant in the jail to see if he qualifies.
(3/13/19 - per SPD Atty Tara Teesch, she was informed this is a SAR and she will be taking the case. Judge Ehlers will not be appointing counsel as defendant qualified for SPD representation)
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: from defendant asking court to appoint counsel to represent him.

No contact direct or indirect with W.P. or his residence.   No contact direct or indirect with S.P., her residence or her place of employment. Maintain absolute sobriety. Not to leave, Door, Kewaunee or Brown Counties.

11:00 AM Defendant Nicholas W Troendle in court, in custody. Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appears by phone.  Defendant Nicholas W Troendle in custody.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file, addresses defendant's motion to reject and terminate probation.  State has no objection to motion. Court questions defendant on motion. Court finds defendant is freely, voluntarily and knowingly terminating his probation, grants motion to reject and terminate probation.  Atty Erickson indicates they will be contacting SPD office in Green Bay to get local counsel appointed. Court reinstates $5,000 cash bond. Status conference set for 3/29/19 at 8:30 am.
to transport

Motion to reject and terminate probation.        Sheryl:  Schedule hearing.  Half hour.  DTE

from defendant requesting copies of victim impacts statements and any pictures that were taken as evidence. State's response. Court will provide copies of victim impact statements to defendant. Court does not have any pictures in the file.

for DNA Sample

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Nicholas W Troendle in court with attorney Peter Raymond Heyne.  Defendant Nicholas W Troendle in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State amends Ct. 7 to Misd. 4th Degree Sexual Assault, amended Ct. 9 to Misd. Intimidation of a Victim. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Cts. 1, 3, 5 & 8 as charged. Defendant enters no contest plea to amended Cts. 7 & 9.   Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas and finds guilty of Cts. 1, 3 5 & 8 as charged and guilty of amended Cts. 7 & 9.   Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge.  Court orders PSI. Bond remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 22, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
from Atty Heyne re: rescheduling hearing
Plea hearing on June 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.
from Atty Heyne requesting phone appearance.

Defendant Nicholas W Troendle in court with attorney Peter Raymond Heyne who appears by phone.  Defendant Nicholas W Troendle in custody.  Joan Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Heyne indicates there are ongoing negotiations to resolve the case, requests another status in a couple weeks. State has no objection. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for April 5, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea.  Bond remains as is.
State's Discovery Demand

Defendant Nicholas W Troendle in court with attorney Peter Raymond Heyne.  Defendant Nicholas W Troendle in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.  Status conference scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Defense Discovery Demand
Audio/Video Supplementary Discovery Demand

Defendant Nicholas W Troendle in court with attorney Peter Raymond Heyne.  Defendant Nicholas W Troendle in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Heyne indicates he was recentely appointed to the case, hasn't seen a copy of the criminal complaint yet. Court will have clerk fax a copy of the complaint to Atty Heyne. Court adjourns matter. Bond remains in effect.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 3, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Nicholas W Troendle in court, in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim. Atty Gerbers appears with defendant, indicates defendant does qualify for PD representation but he will not be representing him. Case has been appointed to Atty Linda Schaefer. Atty Schaefer had conflict this morning, Atty Gerbers requests AIA next Monday. Bond remains in effect.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Defendant was fingerprinted 2/15/16. (fingerprint card destroyed 8/26/16)

No contact direct or indirect with W.P. or his address and S.P. or her address.   Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center. Not to leave Door, Kewaunee or Brown Counties.

Defendant Nicholas W Troendle appears by video conference along with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers who appears in person.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 2/22/16 at 10:00 am.
